Description: Rim and wall sherd of Attic pottery Cassel cup; interior: glazed (fired brown); exterior: black lip above handle zone with double ivy leaf pattern; below, two black bands above myrtle leaf frieze; below, three narrow black bands and band of rays on lower wall.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 124, pl. XXXVIII, no. 350.2)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 41, pl. 109, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1361) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5728 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
